Account Executive (APAC)

Company Name Wrike Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 75 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Wrike is a work management platform, intended to help teams organise their projects and work collaboratively in one place. with over 16,000 customers and over 600 employees based across San Jose & San Diego (California) and Dublin!


We have grown at record speed in the last year and Wrike is now expanding to Melbourne, Australia. As we continue to tackle our goal we intend on building the team with only the best candidates from top to bottom. For the right candidates, there will be ample opportunity for growth and development.


Wrike is looking for an experienced Account Executive to join our team. If you think you've got what it takes for fast paced growth, flexibility to adapt to changes, and the smarts to be the best, then we would love to hear from you.


Role Responsibilities

  • High Activity Based Role incorporating the full cycle
  • Managing the full sales-cycle, including contract generation and other deliverables for closing
  • Understanding an account’s needs and effectively communicate how Wrike will meet those needs
  • Utilising a solution approach to selling and creating value for customers
  • Using SalesForce.com for lead management and sales forecasting
  • Ensure 100% satisfaction with all customers


About You

  • Full fluency in English is essential
  • 2+ years successful selling experience (SaaS Preferred)
  • Experience handling the full sales cycle from qualification to close
  • Experience managing customer relationships and leveraging those relationships to expand business
  • Experience with solution selling
  • Outbound sales calling experience \xa0


Perks & Benefits

  • Market leading base salary
  • Free catered lunch every day plus unlimited drinks and snacks
  • Company sponsored events
  • Flexible working conditions and working from home options

QA Engineer

Company Name Aconex Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 week ago Number of views 531 views

Job description

The purpose of the Quality Assurance Engineer at Oracle / Aconex is to be responsible for assisting the team with building and verifying the developed software and related services. You will be improving the quality of the software that is released into production and assisting the team from concept to delivery in building quality software that meets or exceeds expectations.

Key Responsibilities:


  • Understand, maintain and improve the current testing procedure, sharing ownership with the teams in Australia and globally
  • Develop a deep knowledge of the business rules for existing and new functionality
  • Generate test ideas for validating the product under test and apply appropriate testing
  • Knowledge and proficiency in the use of tools to assist in testing including tools for automated checks, data and environment setup
  • Raise issues for identified product failures and able to perform effective bug advocacy
  • Identify risks for upcoming changes
  • Contribute to enhanced usability of the product by identifying and documenting suggested improvements
  • Able to identify issues at all stages of development


Required Skills and Experience:


Essential:

  • Experience working with mobile applications
  • Able to think outside the box and adapt your testing approach to suit
  • Will challenge what is accepted
  • Experience in working within an Agile development environment
  • Proven experience with Web-application and API testing
  • Proven experience with exploratory testing
  • Willingness to proactively engage in continuous process improvement
  • Strong attention to detail and accuracy of observation
  • Ability to communicate clearly with different areas of the business and team members


Desirable:

  • Practical knowledge of web-based technologies and microservices architecture
  • Programming and scripting experience


Salary: \xa0 80,000 to 100,000

Manager, Digital Channels

Company Name Public Transport Victoria Company Location 750 Collins St, Docklands Victoria 3008

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 121 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

\xa0

  • Challenge yourself and deliver in one of the most significant and exciting digital communication roles in government
  • Fantastic opportunity to make a real impact to a huge Public Transport audience
  • Be part of an energised team and drive transformation of PTV's digital customer information experience
  • Full Time,\xa0Ongoing\xa0Position
  • STS\xa0\xa0$158,730 - $215,875 + 9.5% superannuation
  • Docklands location, close to Southern Cross Station
  • PTV is committed to attracting the best talent and is open to discussing flexible work arrangements


    • \xa0

    About the role

    Customers are expecting greater flexibility and options to interact with public transport in their channel of choice and PTV is taking a holistic multi-channel view of the customer.

    \xa0

    PTV’s digital channels are the primary channel for passenger information delivery and growing rapidly year on year, as technology and public transport use increases.

    \xa0

    This is a specialist customer communication and digital channel development role that is responsible for generating and delivering strategies that see PTV known as the authoritative, network-wide provider of accurate and real-time customer information and content, that is engaging, educative and available across digital channels.

    \xa0

    Leading a dedicated team and working closely with PTV’s senior leadership, internal and external stakeholders, including public transport operators, the role will generate and deploy strategies for information delivery that promotes digital self-service options for customers.

    \xa0

    You’ll drive the future of network-wide digital channel delivery including journey planning, real time information, myki account use, social media engagement and ensuring the provision and availability of accurate, timely and consistent customer information.

    \xa0

    What we’re looking for

    Essential (must have to be considered for the position)

    \xa0

    • An exceptional customer communication and digital customer experience specialist.

    • Demonstrated outstanding experience and success in the delivery of customer information and digital projects.

    • Significant experience in successfully delivering customer service and self-service improvements through digital solutions.

    • Exceptional leadership skills and proven ability to develop and steer a team of dedicated digital customer experience specialists.

    • Demonstrated superior negotiation and commercial skills, supported through strong numerical, analytical and exceptional problem-solving skills.

    • Exceptional stakeholder skills including the ability to confidently negotiate highly complex issues to a successful resolution and provide clear and authoritative advice to a diverse range of senior stakeholders.

      \xa0

    Qualifications

    Mandatory

    • Tertiary degree in a relevant field

      \xa0

    How to apply

    Please click the ‘Apply Now’ button below. Your application must include a cover letter and separate resume (MS Word compatible). For further information about the role, please refer to the attached position description and capability framework documents. If you have any questions specific to the role, please phone: 0417532 677 or email philip.askew@ptv.vic.gov.au

    \xa0

    Applications close 11:59 P.M. Wednesday, 26th September 2018

    \xa0

    Emailed applications will not be accepted.

    \xa0

    Unsolicited recruitment agency applications will not be accepted.

    \xa0

    Public Transport Victoria is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and supports diversity and flexibility. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

    \xa0

    \xa0

    \xa0

850027373:
[

HR Advisor - Maternity Leave Contract

Company Name Toll People Company Location Altona North, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 29 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Who are we?
The Toll Group is the Asian region's leading provider of integrated logistics services, generating annual revenue of AU$8.3 billion and employing over 40,000 people across an extensive network of 1,200 sites throughout more than 50 countries across the world. We're committed to providing a safe, diverse, satisfying and fulfilling workplace for all of our people. We value integrity, trust, teamwork and being open and transparent.

The opportunity?
As part of Toll Group's new growth strategy, an opportunity has become available for a HR Advisor to support the HR services regional teams by providing comprehensive HR services to the relevant managers and staff across various Toll business units. Reporting to the HR Manager, you will be responsible in assisting and leading the development and implementation of the Human Resources Services strategy, plans and processes, consistent with the strategic direction of Toll Group Human Resources.

Key accountabilities and responsibilities will include, but not be limited to:

  • Providing advice and day-to-day support to managers on various issues including general HR/ policy and payroll enquiries, performance management and grievances
  • Delivering a consistent and effective recruitment process (including coaching managers) along with carrying out successful regional onboarding of new and existing employees including Letters of Offer, Contracts of Employment and induction packs
  • Deliver successful regional on-boarding of new & existing employees including the issuing of Letters of Offer/Contracts of Employment and management of induction pack, and enrolment in compliance training
  • Provide advice and support manager to enter or complete Workday tasks
  • Assist with reporting on HR Metrics such as staff turnover, recruitment, employee numbers etc


The ideal candidate?
The ideal candidate will have the relevant qualifications in Human Resource or Business related disciple combined with demonstrated experience working in a similar role. You will possess exceptional problem solving abilities, strong communication both verbal and written along with excellent time management, planning and organisational skills. You will also have the ability to establish and maintain effective relationships and be able to coach and empower others along with the ability to communicate effectively across all levels.

In return, you will be rewarded with an inclusive and dynamic team environment, a passionate company culture and the opportunity to be an integral part of Toll's new direction.


We will not be liable for any fees or costs associated with unsolicited CVs sent directly to line managers from recruitment agencies.

Contact the job poster

Samantha S.

Talent Acquisition Consultant at Toll People

Melbourne, Australia

Job description

About the role

The Legal Counsel is a proven legal practitioner who will thrive in a high paced and collaborative environment and is passionate about providing legal advice and hands on practical support services in a project-based environment.

\xa0

This is a unique opportunity to be a part of the Local Organising Committee who will be working together to deliver A Spectacular Celebration in 2020.

\xa0

About you

  • You are a registered legal practitioner who has 6-8 years in a law firm or in house
  • You are an analytical thinker with meticulous attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • You have strong relationship building skills, and a willingness to be hands on and partner with internal stakeholders
  • You are able to provide sound and practical advice on routine to large scale complex matters
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • You demonstrate strong initiative and ability to manage priorities in a timely manner
  • Experience supporting and implementing procurement processes

\xa0

You will act as a true business partner to senior management and understand the balance of meeting both legal and commercial outcomes. You must be adaptable in your approach and enjoy working in a high energy, innovative and fast paced setting with a proven ability to deliver on immovable deadlines under pressure ideally gained within the major events or sporting landscape.

\xa0

Keen to join our team?

Applications must be emailed to jobs@worldt20.com.au and include a cover letter outlining your interest and expectations by midnight Wednesday 19 September 2018.

\xa0

\xa0

The WT20 offer a competitive salary package, employee benefits, flexible working conditions and a fun working environment.

We embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We value diversity. We encourage all people to apply for this role.

Logistics Manager

Company Name Woolworths Supermarkets Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 6 hours ago Number of views 19 views

Job description

About Us

About the role

Logistics Manager - Truganina

Is team culture important to you? Are you motivated to make a difference and get close to manufacturing?
  • Truganina VIC location
  • Genuine internal progression available
  • Motivate and lead a team
  • Work with an SAP led, automated warehousing system

In this role, you’ll lead the end-to-end operational management of the logistics function in line with strategic priorities to ensure the smooth running of day-to-day operations. You’ll work effectively with stakeholders ensuring the warehouse is a productive, positive and safe operating environment for all staff.

As a part of, and in collaboration with, the management team, you’ll improve productivity and efficiency by using initiative, strategy and leadership to drive continuous improvement to ensure the site runs at its optimum.

In this role you will be responsible for-
  • Developing the Logistics department, in line with business strategy
  • Ensuring the department is operated safely, kept in good working order and budgets are achieved.
  • Workforce planning - continual process of aligning staff to business requirements.
  • Coaching and monitoring warehouse KPIs to meet operational targets
  • Coaching and developing your team - developing expertise and performance of staff to help meet business goals and improve performance and breadth of skills overall.
  • SHE focus to eliminate injuries to staff and reduce damage to equipment.
  • Managing a largely robotised materials handling system, where receipt of goods, storage and picking are almost entirely automated.

This role is based at Truganina and reports to the site Operations Manager

About You

Hilton Foods Australia is part of the Hilton Food Group based in the UK, with meat manufacturing plants throughout the UK, Western & Central Europe and Australia.

Hilton is a dynamic & progressive business with a strong reputation for quality & innovation within the fresh food industry.

Hilton invests heavily in all its facilities to maintain the state of the art levels required to service its customers' growth. We progressively extend the range of products supplied to customers, deliver first class service levels & continually increase production efficiency. Hilton continues to grow through additional volumes and close cooperation with our retail partners.

Hilton Foods Australia has a long term partnership with Woolworths Limited, to supply Woolworths Supermarkets with packaged and value-added meat product. Working together, we focus on strengthening our world class meat offer in Australia, by delivering affordable, innovative and convenient protein choices to customers.

We are renowned to work in warm, passionate collaborative environment and expect you to value this as well as-
  • Extensive experience in FMCG, Manufacturing or Logistics/ Supply Chain operations
  • Preferably an understanding of automation/ robotics.
  • Significant experience in a Logistics management role
  • An understanding of SHE issues and Quality principles
  • The ability to identify and solve problems
  • Organisation skills and attention to detail
  • Initiative and ability to provide complete follow-through on areas of responsibility
  • An ability to be 'hands on' and an outcomes focused attitude
  • A great people leader with excellent communication and listening skills

If this is the role for you please apply

If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!
